decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to aggressively control the board with a versatile selection of creatures and spells. By utilizing a combination of powerful creatures like Ezio Auditore da Firenze, Basim Ibn Ishaq, and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd, along with removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Fatal Push, the deck aims to maintain a strong presence on the battlefield while disrupting the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the inclusion of counter spells like Force of Will and Mana Leak helps to protect key threats and maintain dominance in the game. Overall, the deck focuses on applying pressure early and maintaining control throughout the match to secure a victory.

This deck focuses on utilizing the partner commanders Ravos, Soultender and Thrasios, Triton Hero to create a powerful aggro strategy. The deck includes a wide range of efficient creatures, such as Birds of Paradise, Dark Confidant, and Stoneforge Mystic, as well as powerful spells like Demonic Tutor, Survival of the Fittest, and Green Sun's Zenith. The deck also includes valuable utility cards like Swords to Plowshares and Teferi, Time Raveler to control the game and protect your board. With a strong mana base and access to powerful tutors, this deck aims to quickly establish a dominant board presence and overwhelm your opponent with relentless aggression.

The main strategy of this deck is to deploy efficient creatures and disruptive spells to control the board while applying pressure on the opponent. Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd serves as the commander and provides a powerful aggro strategy, supported by cards like Mother of Runes, Stoneforge Mystic, and Sword of Plowshares. The deck also includes various hate cards such as Containment Priest and Ranger of Eos to disrupt the opponent's game plan. With a mix of card advantage engines like Ranger-Captain of Eos and Palace Jailer, along with removal options like Oust and Path to Exile, the deck aims to outvalue and outpace the opponent in a 1 vs 1 duel format, ultimately overwhelming them with a steady stream of threats.

This deck is focused on controlling the board and disrupting the opponent's strategy while slowly building up a powerful battlefield presence. It features a mix of counterspells, removal, and disruptive creatures like Meddling Mage and Thalia, Heretic Cathar to slow down the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes powerful card advantage engines like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Snapcaster Mage to ensure a steady stream of threats and answers. With a solid mana base and efficient spells like Swords to Plowshares and Stoneforge Mystic to tutor up equipment, this deck aims to outvalue the opponent and win through incremental advantage and efficient combat.

The deck focuses on control and manipulation of the game through counter spells, removal, and card advantage. The key strategy involves utilizing Atraxa's abilities to gain advantage in the game, while also disrupting the opponent's plans through a variety of spells. The deck includes a mix of control elements such as counterspells like Force of Will and Cryptic Command, removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Swords to Plowshares, and card advantage tools like Brainstorm and Demonic Tutor. The mana base is diverse to ensure consistency and flexibility in casting spells. Overall, the deck aims to control the game tempo, disrupt the opponent's strategy, and eventually win through incremental advantage.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing a variety of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw effects to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Atraxa, Grand Unifier serves as the commander, providing additional utility and versatility with her abilities. The deck includes a mix of powerful control cards like Counterspell, Force of Will, and Supreme Verdict, along with versatile removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Swords to Plowshares. Card advantage is gained through spells like Brainstorm, Demonic Tutor, and Mystic Confluence. The mana base is designed to support the control strategy, with a mix of dual lands and fetch lands to ensure consistent access to the necessary colors of mana.

The primary focus of this deck is to heavily control the game through counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage while utilizing the commander, Ertai Resurrected, to continually threaten opponents' strategies. By running a high number of interaction spells and powerful creatures, such as True-Name Nemesis and Vendilion Clique, the goal is to disrupt the opponent's game plan and outvalue them with powerful spells like Cryptic Command and Treachery. Additionally, the deck aims to maintain card advantage through cards like Brainstorm and Mystic Confluence while disrupting the opponent's resources with Wasteland effects and graveyard hate. Overall, the strategy revolves around maintaining control of the game and outlasting opponents with powerful threats and disruptive spells.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game by using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive creatures to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Glarb, Calamity's Augur serves as the commander, providing card advantage and flexibility in dealing with threats. The deck includes a mix of versatile spells like Force of Will, Demonic Tutor, and Cryptic Command, as well as efficient removal options like Fatal Push and Abrupt Decay. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure smooth color access and includes utility lands like Mystic Sanctuary and Boseiju, Who Endures. Overall, the goal is to outmaneuver the opponent and dictate the pace of the game to secure victory.
